results.title: The Living north
results.creator_credit: Neil Howe, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Surveys the potential of the Northern Territory, depicting its industries such as mining, fisheries, beef cattle and pearling and studying developments in transport, education and housing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Neil Howe, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Chase that dream
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Tom Manefield, Australia. Dept. of Housing and Construction and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties faced by low income earners in trying to save money to buy their own home or even rent decent premises. Emphasises how important housing is in people’s lives and how a decision taken at one stage affects their ability to get suitable housing later. Cast includes Laurel McGowan, Peter Fisher, Harry Lawrence, Alan Penney, May Howlett, Gary Files. Credits also include camera; Dean Semler and music; John Gillard.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 039
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A poultry farm at Werribbe Victoria is shown producing eggs by the million. The latest design for a three way hat designed by Australian milliner John Pickworth ius revealed. Baby animlas at Taronga Park Zoo are favourites. The process of reclaiming salt from the sea and a salt refinery in South Australia are shown. Big game fishing - shark and marlin are caught near Sydney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

Baby animlas at Taronga Park Zoo are favourites. The process of reclaiming salt from the sea and a salt refinery in South Australia are shown. Big game fishing - shark and marlin are caught near Sydney.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 050
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a self-taught sculptor makes First Nations people the subject of his work; a Child Welfare Centre is a boon in New Guinea; plastic bowls show they run true to form and a history of duelling through the ages is shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Public enemies
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Collings, Australian National Film Board and Department of Information
results.brief_description: Vividly shows the consequences of acts of vandalism in Australian cities, with particular emphasis on vandalism by adolescents of Post Office property.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Collings, Australian National Film Board and Department of Information

results.title: Australian diary. No. 018
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: the Tobruk Memorial to the fallen is unveiled; champions start a boom in table tennis; banana growing in New South Wales is shown and the Wyatt Earp Antarctic Expedition is shown.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 123
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan, Australian National Film Board and Dept of the Interior
results.brief_description: Magazine items: The giant telescope at Parkes, N.S.W. is the largest in the Southern Hemisphere. It is occupied with a fulltime research programme into radio astronomy. At Collaroy, Sydney, the Salvation Army has organized a unique Music Camp for children,from eight to fifteen years. University College of Townsville is the first in the state of Queensland outside Brisbane.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 026
results.brief_description: Sydney artists Geoff Pike and Bob Booth exhibit their paintings on a floating gallery, the “One Step”, and profits from sales are to finance further their voyage around the Pacific Islands. Also featured is the launching of the Blue Streak Rocket from Woomera, the holiday resort of Forster on the New South Wales coast with its history, scenic surroundings and facilities.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 043
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: migrants learn to be Australian citizens; the fine art of trout fishing is diplayed; and a closer look at tennis raquets which will help Australian players win prestigious trophies like the Davis Cup.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 043. Three Directions in Pop Music
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Offers a sample of three trends in recent Australian pop music: the theatrical act of Wendy Saddington and Teardrop; the jug music of the Captain Matchbox Whoopee Band; and the popular rock group Indelible Murtceps.
